metadata.title: CVE-2019-15221 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Compliant (xenial) - negligible
metadata.description:
An issue was discovered in the Linux kernel before 5.1.17. There is a NULLpointer dereference caused by a malicious USB device in thesound/usb/line6/pcm.c driver.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-15221` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-174-generic - 4.4.0-174.204
linux-image-4.4.0-174-generic-lpae - 4.4.0-174.204
linux-image-4.4.0-174-lowlatency - 4.4.0-174.204
linux-image-4.4.0-174-powerpc-e500mc - 4.4.0-174.204
linux-image-4.4.0-174-powerpc-smp - 4.4.0-174.204
linux-image-4.4.0-174-powerpc64-emb - 4.4.0-174.204
linux-image-4.4.0-174-powerpc64-smp - 4.4.0-174.204
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-174-generic - 4.4.0-174.204
linux-image-unsigned-4.4.0-174-lowlatency - 4.4.0-174.204
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-60-generic - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-60-generic-lpae - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
linux-image-4.15.0-60-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-60-generic - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-60-lowlatency - 4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1066-kvm - 4.4.0-1066.73
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1102-aws - 4.4.0-1102.113
No subscription required

linux-image-4.15.0-1047-aws - 4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1056-azure - 4.15.0-1056.61
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1041-gcp - 4.15.0-1041.43
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1022-oracle - 4.15.0-1022.25~16.04.1
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1129-raspi2 - 4.4.0-1129.138
No subscription required

linux-image-4.4.0-1133-snapdragon - 4.4.0-1133.141
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-174.204').
linux-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-60.67~16.04.1').
linux-oem: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support, was needs-triage').
linux-kvm package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1066.73').
linux-aws package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1102.113').
linux-aws-hwe package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1047.49~16.04.1').
linux-azure package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1056.61').
linux-gcp package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1041.43').
linux-oracle package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.15.0-1022.25~16.04.1').
linux-raspi2 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1129.138').
linux-snapdragon package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1133.141').
